bibl.title: Letter from [s.n.] Miller to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 28, 1917

div1.p: Miller informs Kean that he is unable to supply a list of commissioned officers in Allentown.

div1.head: Letter from [s.n.] Miller to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 28, 1917
div1.opener:
REM-R
WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL,
WASHINGTON.
July 28, 1917.
Col. Jefferson R. Kean, Med. Corps,
Nutley, New Jersey.
Dear Colonel Kean:
div1.p:
In reference to your request for a list of the
commissioned officers at Allentown, Noble tells me that a
number of these are to be eliminated by Persons as not quali-
fied for that particular service, and those eliminated are to
be replaced by new selections. It is, therefore, impracticable
for the present to furnish any list that would be of value to you.

Persons has been informed of all promotions as they
were recommended, consequently he has full data in regard to the
matter, and he will have knowledge of the changes in the personnel
before we will. As his recommendations in the case will be followed,
would suggest that you ask him to furnish you the information as it
is available.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, Miller Enclosed with Gen. Gorgas's letter of July 31st 1917-
